conclusion: Determine how shadows will change when the light source moves forward above the objects.
Position of the light source is currently above the objects, casting shadows directly below them.
When the light source moves forward, it will be closer to the objects but still above them.
Shadow of the mushrooms will shift slightly forward as the light source moves closer.
Primary change for mushrooms will be in the size of the shadow rather than its position.
Shadow of the tree trunk will shift slightly forward as the light source moves closer.
Primary change for tree trunk will be in the size of the shadow.
Shadow of the white object will shift forward and likely become larger.
Shadow of the book will shift forward and likely become larger.
Shadow of the mushrooms will increase in size because the light source is closer.
Shadow of the tree trunk will increase in size for the same reason as the mushrooms.
Shadow of the white object will increase in size as the light source moves closer.
Shadow of the book will increase in size as the light source moves closer.
Shadows will shift slightly forward in position and increase in size due to closer proximity of the light source.
Primary changes will be in the size of the shadows, becoming larger and more pronounced.
